reg_pit.title: BC Instrument 51-509 Issuers Quoted in the U.S. Over-the-Counter Markets

change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 235/2012, effective July 31, 2012.

reg.title: BC Instrument 51-509 Issuers Quoted in the U.S. Over-the-Counter Markets
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 227/2009, March 27, 2010]

paragraph.paragraphtext: that has issued a class of securities that are OTC-quoted securities, and
that has not issued any class of securities that are listed or quoted on

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: Canadian Trading and Quotation System Inc.,

definition.def: means a class of securities that has been assigned a ticker symbol on the OTC Bulletin Board or the Pink Sheets;
means an OTC issuer that is a reporting issuer;
means the date that an OTC issuer is first assigned a ticker symbol for any class of its securities on the OTC Bulletin Board or Pink Sheets.

section.sectiontext: Terms used in this Instrument that are defined or interpreted in National Instrument 14-101 Definitions or National Instrument 51-102 Continuous Disclosure Obligations have the same meaning in this Instrument.
Subject to section 4, an OTC issuer is a reporting issuer under the Securities Act if

paragraph.paragraphtext: on or after September 15, 2008, its business has been directed or administered in or from British Columbia,
on or after September 15, 2008, investor relations activities have been carried on in or from British Columbia by or on behalf of the OTC issuer, or

the OTC issuer's ticker-symbol date is on or after September 15, 2008, and, on or before the ticker-symbol date, the issuer distributed a security to a person resident in British Columbia and that security is of the class of securities that became the issuer's OTC-quoted securities.

section.marginalnote: Ceasing to be an OTC reporting issuer

subsection.subsectiontext: An OTC issuer ceases to be a reporting issuer under section 3 if

paragraph.paragraphtext: its business is not directed or administered, and has not been directed or administered for at least one year, in or from British Columbia,
investor relations activities, by or on behalf of it, are not carried on, and have not been carried on for at least one year, in or from British Columbia,
more than one year has passed since its ticker-symbol date, and
it has filed a notice in the required form.

subsection.subsectiontext: An OTC reporting issuer that ceases to be an OTC issuer must file a notice in the required form at least 10 days before it is next required to file a record.

section.sectiontext: In addition to all other provisions of securities legislation that apply to a reporting issuer, an OTC reporting issuer must comply with the provisions of

paragraph.paragraphtext: National Instrument 13-101 System for Electronic Data Analysis and Retrieval (SEDAR) that apply to an electronic filer, despite section 2.1 of that Instrument,
National Instrument 51-102 Continuous Disclosure Obligations that apply to a reporting issuer that is a venture issuer,
Part 6 of National Instrument 51-102 Continuous Disclosure Obligations despite section 6.1 of that Instrument,
National Instrument 52-110 Audit Committees that apply to a reporting issuer that is a venture issuer, and
National Instrument 58-101 Disclosure of Corporate Governance Practices that apply to a reporting issuer that is a venture issuer.

section.sectiontext: Section 14.2 of National Instrument 71-101 The Multijurisdictional Disclosure System does not apply to an OTC reporting issuer.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an OTC issuer becomes a reporting issuer on its ticker-symbol date, the OTC reporting issuer must file, within 5 days of the date it became a reporting issuer, a copy of the most recent registration statement it filed with the SEC.
The OTC reporting issuer must file the registration statement in electronic format under section 2.2 of National Instrument 13-101 System for Electronic Data Analysis and Retrieval (SEDAR).

If a person will carry on investor relations activities under an agreement, arrangement, commitment or understanding with an OTC reporting issuer, the OTC reporting issuer must file a notice in the required form describing the activities and the relationship of the OTC reporting issuer with the person.
The OTC reporting issuer must file the notice under subsection (1)

paragraph.paragraphtext: at least 1 day before the investor relations activities commence, or
if, on the date the OTC issuer became an OTC reporting issuer, investor relations activities are being carried on, within 5 days of that date.

subsection.subsectiontext: The OTC reporting issuer must file the notice in electronic format in accordance with National Instrument 13-101 System for Electronic Data Analysis and Retrieval (SEDAR).

section.sectiontext: Section 4.1 of National Instrument 43-101 Standards of Disclosure for Mineral Projects does not apply to an OTC reporting issuer.

subsection.subsectiontext: The exemptions in securities legislation from the registration requirement or the prospectus requirement do not apply to a trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer on or after the ticker-symbol date, if the security was acquired on or after September 15, 2008 and before the ticker-symbol date, except for the exemption in section 2.16 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions.
A person must not trade a security of an OTC reporting issuer that the person acquired on or after September 15, 2008 and before the ticker-symbol date unless

paragraph.paragraphtext: the certificate representing the security carries the legend, or the ownership statement issued under a direct registration system or other electronic book entry system relating to the security bears the legend restriction notation, set out in subsection 11 (2),
the person trades the security through an investment dealer from an account at that investment dealer in the name of that person, and
the investment dealer executes the trade through the OTC Bulletin Board or Pink Sheets.

subsection.subsectiontext: As soon as practicable after the ticker-symbol date, an OTC reporting issuer must place

paragraph.paragraphtext: a legend on each certificate representing a security issued before the ticker-symbol date, and
a legend restriction notation on each ownership statement issued under a direct registration system or other electronic book entry system relating to a security issued before the ticker-symbol date.

subsection.subsectiontext: The legend or legend restriction notation must state the following:

subsandwich.em: Unless otherwise permitted under securities legislation, the holder of this security must not trade the security in or from British Columbia unless

paragraphtext.em: the security holder trades the security through an investment dealer registered in British Columbia from an account at that dealer in the name of that security holder, and
the dealer executes the trade through the OTC Bulletin Board or Pink Sheets.

section.marginalnote: Resale of private placement securities acquired after ticker-symbol date

subsection.subsectiontext: Unless the conditions in subsection (2) are satisfied, the first trade by a person of a security of an OTC reporting issuer distributed to that person after the ticker-symbol date under an exemption from the prospectus requirement is a distribution.
For the purposes of subsection (1), the conditions are

paragraph.paragraphtext: a 4-month period has passed from the date

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the OTC reporting issuer distributed the security, or
a control person distributed the security,

section.parasandwich: unless the security was acquired under a director or employee stock option,

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the person trading the security is a control person of the OTC reporting issuer, the person has held the security for at least 6 months,

the number of securities the person proposes to trade, plus the number of securities of the OTC reporting issuer of the same class that the person has traded in the preceding 12-month period, does not exceed 5% of the OTC reporting issuer's outstanding securities of the same class,
the person trades the security through an investment dealer,
the investment dealer executes the trade through the OTC Bulletin Board or the Pink Sheets,
there has been no unusual effort made to prepare the market or create a demand for the security,
no extraordinary commission or other consideration is paid to a person for the trade,
if the person trading the security is an insider of the OTC reporting issuer, the person reasonably believes that the OTC reporting issuer is not in default of securities legislation, and

the certificate representing the security carries a legend, or the ownership statement issued under a direct registration system or other electronic book entry system relating to the security bears a legend restriction notation, stating the following:

parasandwich.em: Unless otherwise permitted under securities legislation, the holder of this security must not trade the security in or from British Columbia unless the conditions in section 12 (2) of BC Instrument 51-509 Issuers Quoted in the U.S. Over-the-Counter Markets are met.

section.sectiontext: Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.5 and 2.6 of National Instrument 45-102 Resale of Securities do not apply to the first trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer distributed under an exemption from the prospectus requirement.
Section 2.14 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions does not apply to a trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer.
Section 4.2 of Multilateral Instrument 62-104 Take-Over Bids and Issuer Bids does not apply to a take-over bid for an OTC reporting issuer for two years after the ticker-symbol date.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (2), this Instrument comes into force on September 15, 2008.
Sections 5, 6, 7, and 8 come into force on September 30, 2008.

section.marginalnote: Transition — financial disclosure for non-SEC filers
section.sectiontext: For an OTC reporting issuer that does not have a class of securities registered under section 12 of the 1934 Act and is not required to file reports under section 15 (d) of the 1934 Act, the requirements of Multilateral Instrument 51-102 Continuous Disclosure Obligations and Multilateral Instrument 52-109 Certification of Disclosure in Issuers' Annual and Interim Filings concerning the filing of

paragraph.paragraphtext: annual financial statements, related MD & A and annual certificates apply only to financial years beginning on or after January 1, 2008,
interim financial statements, related MD & A and interim certificates apply only to interim periods that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: begin on or after January 1, 2008, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: AIFs apply only to financial years beginning on or after January 1, 2008.

section.sectiontext: If an OTC reporting issuer is a reporting issuer in British Columbia and not in any other jurisdiction of Canada, National Instrument 52-110 Audit Committees does not apply to an OTC reporting issuer until the earlier of:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the issuer's first annual meeting on or after September 30, 2008, and
September 30, 2009.

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Securities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 418, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 184]

change.changenote: Section 10 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 227/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: The exemptions in securities legislation from the registration requirement or the prospectus requirement do not apply to a trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer on or after the ticker-symbol date, if the security was acquired on or after September 15, 2008 and before the ticker-symbol date, except for the exemption in section 2.16 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions.

change.changenote: Section 10 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 227/2009, effective March 27, 2010/

subsection.subsectiontext: The exemptions in securities legislation from the registration requirement or the prospectus requirement do not apply to a trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer on or after the ticker-symbol date, if the security was acquired on or after September 15, 2008 and before the ticker-symbol date, except for the exemptions in sections 2.16 and 3.16 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions.

change.changenote: Section 14 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 227/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

section.sectiontext: Section 2.14 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions does not apply to a trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer.

change.changenote: Section 14 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 227/2009, effective March 27, 2010/

section.sectiontext: Sections 2.14 and 3.14 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions do not apply to a trade of a security of an OTC reporting issuer.
